title: Why I think Zed is an Unhealthy Assassin
body:
{{champion:238}} is considered by Riot and for a while most of the community as a healthy assassin with a lot of counterplay while also having a lot of pick potential. I used to also think like this before I began to think on the role of Assassins, and how they should be operating in a game such as league of legends. I personally think {{champion:121}} is the healthiest assassin in the game, but I'll get to that later. 

{{champion:238}} is an odd champion because he has very clear early game dominance, but all of this is loaded into one ability his Q. The good and  bad Zed players are defined by how often they can hit their Q (and how good they are at using shadows to dodge). This is because his Q is simply all of the damage in his kit. His ult comes down to "Can I hit my double Q on the enemy and one AA?" His waveclear begins to become ridiculous around lvl 7 (on par with champions such as {{champion:161}} or {{champion:112}}). 

Basically Zed does a few things really well 1) His double Q chunks for around 35-45% of an enemies HP in lane phase 2) His W allows him to zone opponents for the 4 seconds it is up. 3) His shadow also allows him great mobility around the map. 4) He has some of the best waveclear out of the assassin class. 

This is where the issue begins to show up. Zed does a little bit of everything. He's good in teamfights due to the damage on his Q. He's good at picking off targets due to his passive and Ult. His shadows allow him mobility around the battlefield. He doesn't seem to fall on the large design of what assassins are supposed to be 1) Punishing teams with bad team fight control 2) Punishing teams for lack of warding 3) Punishing players for positioning errors outside of teamfights. He instead feels like he is an AD mage that is melee while also having the benefits of the Assassin. 

I think {{champion:121}} is the healthiest assassin because he fits the role of an assassin perfectly. He looks for a chance to get on the enemies back line and punish them with his isolation mechanic. Outside of teamfights he shines by using his ult to get past common ward locations, and getting kills on unsuspecting enemies. Basically if assassin itemization was better he'd be in a near perfect spot. 

What I'd like to see on Zed is for Riot to encourage his pick potential while tuning back his early game power and teamfight power. To do this his energy costs would need to go up (perhaps 65 energy on his Q at all ranks) but his energy refund would need to go up (reward good zed players). Refund energy upon kills. Reduce his shadow duration to 2.5 seconds, but decrease the CD upon receiving a kill. Basically you want to make Zed into a high mobility assassin with high damage if he is allowed on the backline, but cause him to have a smaller window to engage. Have a less oppressive early game (without nerfing his damage) while gaining late game pick potential.

Edit: I think some of you guys are confused. This isn't a Zed is OP post and Kha'zix is balanced post. I think Kha'zix is slightly underpowered and Zed is balanced stat wise. This is a stance on design philosophy not balance. When I say unhealthy I'm saying that their design is counterproductive to what league should be striving for. Healthy being the opposite (what they should be striving for).

replies.body:
Zed needs his wave clear NERFED.

it is absolutely ridiculous that he can out push every single champion in the game and is resourceless.


I don't have a problem with his damage, but I do have a problem with Zed at lvl 3 being able to clear a wave faster and safer than any other champ in the game. He either can out right kill you AND out farm you, or if they are bad, the best you can do is push them under tower.

You can't deny him CS cause he just shawdow spams the entire minion wave and it dies, you can't really deny him CS under tower because he can clear the wave in 1 rotation and be back to full resource before the next one arrives.

He also gains damage in his auto attack making him able to push the wave and your tower faster than any other mid laner. He needs to just deal 50% dmg to minions on everything except his auto attack, he can keep his full damage to monsters but the free and constant wave clear on him from lvl 3+ is not cool.

Seriously nerf this guys ability to clear waves and he will be very well balanced as he has nice damgage, good escapes, but can be CC'd and shut down and mostly out ranged by mages. It's not his kit or his damage that makes him so hated, it's the fact you can not punish him for poor play.

I agree with reduced damage to minions and his insane mana less wave clear

They could also nerf his slow or Decrease the damage on his q for each minion/champion it passes through like Orianna or make his shadows do less damage(percentage from zed's, perhaps 80% or 85%).
You mean like it already does? L2P
They already do 50% damage to all characters past the first.

>Resourceless

Manaless.
may as well be resourceless, its not hard to manage energy

Whenever it's harder or easier, that is situational.

Energy is better for burst, but it's awful in prolonged fights.
good thing hes an assassin then.

Good thing pretty much every champion using energy is an assassin.

Except Shen. Nobody likes Shen anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-24T14:44:13.910+0000)
>
> Whenever it's harder or easier, that is situational.
> 
> Energy is better for burst, but it's awful in prolonged fights.

oh yea, it really hurts him when he gets into those long poke fights huh?

"energy is awful in fights Zed never takes"
If he doesn't it means he's out of the fight for 15 seconds on average.

> [{quoted}](name=3Ez5MeZe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-23T19:28:21.222+0000)
>  resourceless.

Stopped reading right there because you don't seem to understand the champion at all. He uses energy, he is not resource-less, he is mana-less.

I think what he means is that a lot of energy champions seem to have no resources because their energy comes back a lot faster than mana, thus they tend to feel a lot more spammy.

I'm not saying you're wrong, I'm just saying I understand where he's coming from.

Voice of reason here. First thing to note if you disagree with this, don't worry forums are a vocal minority in terms of opinion. 

If you agree with any of the Zed complaints, just chill and listen up.

**He's an assassin, assassins needs gold to be effective. He's balanced around the gold he gaiins. **

These are the most picked mids

{{champion:99}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:34}}

Notice anything?

Here are the highest win rate mids

{{champion:10}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:26}} {{champion:41}} 

Notice it yet?

Let's isolate the repeats

{{champion:99}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:34}} 

And what do we have? Assassins, 2 champs that innately do well against assassins and an adc.

Why? Well, there are several mages who should do pretty well against these assassins. But their items still haven't been touched yet. When they're addressed, these faces will change a lot. 

And the part you might hate to hear most? Zed might even be buffed at that time.  The hot successful picks right now are either assassins or champs that don't rely on good itemization to handle them. 

Even the best assassin atm is the one who has innate tools to counter other assassins.

Back to the initial point. **Assassins currently have a pretty easy time getting the gold they need to be effective**. When they aren't successful, it's mainly due to to champions that do well vs. the class as a whole and there aren't a great amount of those.

So chill, learn some patience and wait for the mage update where Zed will probably drop out of meta. Though I understand, the mid lane mains innately counter patience.

Another point, what is after the mage update, yeah assassin. Also ad assassin already get one new item before the mage can even get one. I am not here to complaint vs zed, it is just that mage need love.

Yeah, There were small price hikes on AP items, and AD items got a lot cheaper with the ADC reworks... I mean just look at BF sword.

Since last season it has gone from 1500g > 1300g, and most of the items it builds into got cheaper as well. AP Itemization is FUCKED right now, especially considering that AD mids have more or less always been a thing, but now their items being cheaper makes them a stronger force in lane.

Also, all AD assassins essentially have a Zed ult now, so AD feels way too strong atm.

It makes me sad as a Veigar main.

{{champion:45}} {{item:3070}}

you mean do what riot did to sion 

when playing sion and elveling Q you could oneshot the entire minion wave with it at rank 2, just e the waves charge q and boom all gone

then riot added in a little something so it now only deals 60% damage to minions and now you need rank 4 /5

seems like an idea for zed Q

Zed's passive no longer works on minions. 

He actually has to try to last hit. 

Means that bad zeds dont get farm.

Now Zed is strong when in good hands but is no longer the low elo stomper.
With how much armor pen he needs on his runes in order to be effective, you'd be making it near impossible to farm against a competent opponent
It means that assassins who excel in the mid game and snowball into the late game have a weak point in the game where they can be punished. The way it should be.

> [{quoted}](name=sixdogman,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-02-23T20:21:24.283+0000)
>
> It means that assassins who excel in the mid game and snowball into the late game have a weak point in the game where they can be punished. The way it should be.

Or maybe you don't know what you're talking about. Zed is strongest Mid game and falls off late where hes basically stuck split pushing and trying to catch HVI's out of position.
Because split pushing ceases to be viable late game? He has some of the safest and strongest split pushing in the game, how is that a negative?

While Zed IS in the upper regions of balance and would survive some nerfs, I'd hardly say he needs them, and he's far from unhealthy.

And lets be honest, {{champion:121}} has been knee capped so hard calling him balanced is a plain joke.

Zeds big strength is his laning phase.  Once team fights start, he starts to fall off SLIGHTLY, due to his AoE not being the largest.  I'd honestly argue that {{champion:55}} and {{champion:91}} are better team fight assassins given their AoE, obviously this requires the right team comp though.

> And lets be honest,  {{champion:121}}  has been knee capped so hard calling him balanced is a plain joke.

I feel like people find Kha'zix "healthy" only because he is trash/meh-tier assassin for a while now and Riot is trying to buff him with very minor buff, that don't really help him, because they don't want him to be the monster he was before.

This lead to players forgetting about when kha'zix had all is assassination tools on, he was like Rengar exept he could get out/engage every 10 sec thanks to his ult and his reset leap and he could be as tanky as Alistar with some damage reduction on his evolved ult.
Season 3 manamune Kha'Zix, anyone remember?

People forget an assassins job, it's to pop squishy champs and get away with it.  While I do feel certain immobile champs (*cough* mages *cough*) should be equipped with tools to make this a bit tougher, over all assassins should be able to do their job.  Kha'Zix could do this and then some, even now if you have a really good game, you can pull it off.  (I will never forget my favorite Kha'Zix game, Ascension, near full build.  Hit stealth and popped a near full health Zed so fast he didn't even know who had hit him.)  

Right now though, his skill floor is just too high.  It's possible to do well with him, but to really do great with him, you've got to MAIN him and be willing to take all the beating that will come with that life style.

By healthy I don't mean balanced. Numbers rise and fall all the time. I personally think his numbers are a bit low right now. When I say healthy I mean the design behind their kit fits well in the game.

By your definitions:

Healthy = 2 Useless abilities, One gimmicky ability, and One spammable burst move that only needs two casts in order to kill squishies. This is constant reliable burst, with barely any restraints mid-late game.

Unhealthy = Champ that requires ult to kill until midgame, with two damaging abilities which are both tied to either skillshots, or being at melee range. Ult can be cancelled with QSS or Zhonyas.


Or are you talking about everything BUT their assassination patterns, like Zed's waveclear , "free ad", etc.?

Because that has nothing to do with the healthiness of a champion based on riots standards. 

When saying if an assassin is healthy or not, they mean their assassination pattern. Zed's is the healthiest by far as its not instant until late game where it needs to be, or if he snowballed out of control in the early.

So good champion design is shoving 75%+ of your power budget into Kha Q and isolation? Kha'zix W and R are both lackluster abilities right now and are mainly used because you don't have anything else to do in your 3 second cd Q. R is used to move around and live for the next Q and W just isn't very good. The slow gets overrode by passive due to slows not stacking anymore and it doesn't do meaningful damage to use since it costs quite a bit of mana.

What aspect of their kit do you feel is unhealthy?

Personal opinion, his laning phase is a bit too strong, not many champs can cs as easily as Zed except maybe {{champion:80}}.  His energy is slightly too forgiving early game while not being enough of a restraint later on in the game.

The fact that he is AD and still scales fairly well with his old carry build means he doesn't fall off nearly as hard towards the late game as an assassin should.

If anything though I think his assassination patter is the healthiest design in the game.  It's very predictable.  You know when he initiates it, where he's going to pop up and have an idea of what he's going to try to do.  Any form of hard CC and/or damage reduction tends to hurt his ability to assassinate.  Add to that, he's one of the few assassins that requires his ult to assassinate through the majority of the game.

Again, these are just my opinions.

For Kha'Zix, while he's versatile, he's also at a point where his skill floor and skill cap are both too high for most non-pro gamers to really excel with him unless you were to main him.  I've had my good games with him, but in general he feels like he's always lagging behind.  I'm either not doing enough damage fast enough or I'm too squishy to properly assassinate a target without some heavy assistance from an ally.  He has a fun play style and is easily one of my favorite assassins for this reason, but he's simply too gimped atm to warrant playing him much.

HAHAHAHAHA, {{champion:121}} most healthy Assassin xD 1 point and click 3 sec CD Q = 60% of targets hp gone, such healthy, such counterplay.

Thank god I only have diamond players in my friendlist, these boards make me laugh and cringe so hard.

It makes sense, if you're caught out alone then he has earned to deal the damage by catching you. In team fights the only way to deal that damage is to fly face first into the enemy team, putting him at a massive risk with a chance to deal no damage at all. So instead of trashing people's opinions read a bit.
It makes 0 sense to have a spammable point and click ability that deletes 60% of your hp. Zed has to hit his shuriken to do damage, there is counterplay, that is where "healthyness" comes in.

Not like it's hard to hit a 'skillshot' when being in melee Range... 

And additianlly - Kha can only deal said DMG if you're alone you can give him a really hard time by grouping which plainly halves his DMG and THAT do I call a play to counter something....

And additionally: Zed, High Pick and Winrate... Kha, Low Pick and Winrate... guess why?
Low winrate because noobs don't know how to play and build him, me and all my friends at high elo who have played Kha have high winrate.

> [{quoted}](name=N00B PWN3R,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=00090001000000010000,timestamp=2016-02-23T23:01:30.957+0000)
>
> Low winrate because noobs don't know how to play and build him, me and all my friends at high elo who have played Kha have high winrate.

Okay Mr. Level 24
It only does 60% of your HP if you're isolated with zero armor.

Zed is, at a kit level, far and away the healthiest and most balanced assassin this game has ever seen.

He has outplay potential on every single part of his kit other than his auto attacks (no one has it here) and his passive (applied via autos). There are numerous items which offer much stronger counter-play options against him than other assassins, he has very high positional requirements, and is frankly the easiest assassin to escape from / kill in most scenarios due to how many things he has to juggle and get right in order to be truly impressive.

When you're against Zed you basically always have a chance, even during his strong lane phase. Compare that to the likes Akali who simply asks "Do I have enough damage and am I level 6? Excellent! Time to be an unpeelable and stealthy burst monster!", Leblance "Am I 6? Do I have the stats? Excellent! Time to become a point-and-click burst monster with 2 dashes I can use multiple times!", and Talon / Kat who are.. Again, simply stat checks and point > click delete in about 1.5 seconds. A lot of this stems from his ultimate, which takes 3 seconds to 'detonate' and provides ample opportunity to escape his clutches, Zhonyas, dispel, shield, or other options.

The problem with outplay potential (especially when mobility involved like with Zed) is that unless you're playing a champion with similarly high outplay basis, you must rely on the the enemy Zed to not be effective at Zed.
His kit provides all the tools necessary to mitigate his own weaknesses.

Early game, His passive and waveclear allow him to acquire gold easily and safely, bypassing one of the main weaknesses of most assassins (weak laning).

Late game, his W's AD amplification passive gives him the damage to outright kill squishies without relying on his ult, allowing him to use it solely as a gap closer and escape.

Basically, He's overcompensated for the unreliablility of his ultimate with too much safety.

> [{quoted}](name=Auz the Ripper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2016-02-23T23:31:59.885+0000)
>
> The problem with outplay potential (especially when mobility involved like with Zed) is that unless you're playing a champion with similarly high outplay basis, you must rely on the the enemy Zed to not be effective at Zed.

Some champions have dashes/blinks. Some champions don't. So what?

Quit pretending that the champions with dashes/blinks are the only ones capable of being played well/poorly. In a matchup of mobile vs immobile, say Zed vs Lux, there is play and counter play for both champs. It's not the case that the Lux is just compelled to play at a certain level and the Zed being good or bad relative to that determines the outcome. There is just as much the Lux can do to win the matchup as there is the Zed. She doesn't have to just sit there spamming abilities hoping the zed is bad and doesn't kill her, stop pretending that's the case. The whole immobile vs mobile, skillshot vs point n click circle jerk is just retarded.

I only metioned mobility twice and it wasn't the main point; Too much safety was the point.

Also Lux is a rather bad choice for comparison as she is even safer than Zed when played correctly.
The fact you even compare Katarina to Zed shows how little you know about these champions.

Your points are 100% valid and educated, but you've come to the wrong neighborhood my friend. Please, don't reason with these people. They cannot handle the truth and are blinded by rage. They will hate on whatever champion the boards deems to be "unhealthy" and constantly write long, stupid posts begging for nerfs instead of learning and improving themselves.
Would explain why I got downvoted despite being +2 earlier

OP, have you ever played against a {{champion:121}}  before his nerfs? Back when {{champion:121}}  was played mid? If you haven't you don't know what you're talking about. As broken as {{champion:238}}  is , he gets a guaranteed kill from lvl 6 everytime his ult is off cooldown. Kha'Zix would do that everytime you steped away from your minion wave.

Zed is a high skill cap champion and high skill floor champion as well. Good Zed are extremely frustrating to play against but bad Zed are the easiest to stomp. The only reason why Riot isn't nerfing Zed because his huge fanboy base wanting to be an edgy ninja while sucking so hard that they drastically drop his win rate from the proficient Zeds.
That said, I rather have a Zed on the enemy team than mine because chances are they suck.

> [{quoted}](name=Seen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-23T19:32:59.231+0000)
>
> Zed is a high skill cap champion and high skill floor champion as well. Good Zed are extremely frustrating to play against but bad Zed are the easiest to stomp. The only reason why Riot isn't nerfing Zed because his huge fanboy base wanting to be an edgy ninja while sucking so hard that they drastically drop his win rate from the proficient Zeds.
> That said, I rather have a Zed on the enemy team than mine because chances are they suck.

Every scrublord can waveclear if he has tools.

> [{quoted}](name=Dirty Roleplayer,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nfnTATUE,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-02-23T20:05:51.669+0000)
>
> Every scrublord can waveclear if he has tools.

You'd be surprised. I've had enemy Zed miss their shurikens at point blank range on more than one occasion. I even met a Lux that missed all of her E except for 3 but that's another story.

Lemme fix that for you:
{{champion:238}} is unhealthy because... here let me list all of his strengths and what he's good at while ignoring his many weaknesses. 
{{champion:121}} is healthy solely based on the fact that he sucks right now. 

Blatant anti-assassin bias at its best. "Sucks = healthy".
